trending.reason: Highlights India's rapid adoption of AI-led robotics in critical sectors like healthcare and agriculture to drive growth.
The James Webb Space Telescope has provided an unprecedented look at a red supergiant just before its supernova, potentially solving a major astrophysical mystery.

articles.title: AI in Robotics: Revolutionising India's Key Sectors
articles.excerpt: The integration of artificial intelligence into robotics is transforming major industries across India, enhancing precision and productivity in healthcare, agriculture, and manufacturing.
articles.author: The Hindu
articles.fullContent:
AI-powered robotics are enhancing efficiency and safety across Indian industries.

AI and Robotics Drive Industrial Transformation

The partnership between artificial intelligence and robotics has moved from science fiction to reality, transforming how industries in India operate, innovate, and create value. This synergy complements human capabilities with unprecedented precision, driving significant advancements in sectors such as healthcare, agriculture, and manufacturing. The global AI-in-robotics market is projected to exceed $80 billion by 2030, highlighting the rapid adoption of intelligent automation.

A New Era of Intelligent Collaboration

At its core, AI allows robots to move beyond pre-programmed instructions, enabling them to learn, adapt, and make autonomous decisions in dynamic environments. By integrating human ingenuity with machine precision, a new generation of intelligent collaboration is emerging. This technology is not about replacing the human workforce but augmenting it; freeing workers from repetitive or hazardous tasks allows them to focus on more creative and strategic responsibilities.

"From precision planting to data-led irrigation, these technologies are built to supplement, not substitute, human intelligence." — The Hindu

In agriculture, AI-driven robots assist with monitoring soil conditions, predicting plant diseases, and mechanising harvesting with increased efficiency. For instance, Telangana's Saagu Baagu initiative has seen over 7,000 farmers adopt AI-based agritech tools, resulting in nearly doubled yields and income. This success demonstrates how AI-led robotics can foster sustainable and inclusive growth.

Fostering Trust and Skill Development

7,000+Farmers in Telangana using AI-agritech tools
$80B+Projected global AI-in-robotics market by 2030

To ensure safe and effective human-machine collaboration, clear accountability frameworks and regulatory guidelines are essential. India's National Strategy for AI, 'AI for All', emphasises transparency, skill development, and ethical deployment to build trust in these intelligent systems. Developing skills to work confidently alongside intelligent machines is just as crucial for the workforce's future.

Key Takeaways

  • ✔ AI is enabling robots to learn and make autonomous decisions, moving beyond simple pre-programmed tasks.
  • ✔ In Indian agriculture, AI tools have helped thousands of farmers double their yields and income through precision farming.
  • ✔ The focus of AI in robotics is to complement human workers by handling dangerous or repetitive tasks, not to replace them.
  • ✔ India's national AI strategy is focused on building ethical guidelines and promoting skill development to ensure safe human-machine collaboration.

articles.title: JWST Reveals Hidden 'Doomed' Star, Solving Cosmic Mystery
articles.excerpt: The James Webb Space Telescope has captured an unprecedented image of a massive red supergiant star just before its supernova, solving the long-standing mystery of why these stars are rarely observed exploding.
articles.author: Live Science
articles.fullContent:
The James Webb Space Telescope's infrared capabilities allow it to see through cosmic dust.

Webb Telescope Solves Mystery of Missing Supernovae

The James Webb Space Telescope (JWST) has revealed a hidden 'doomed' star, providing a solution to a giant astrophysical mystery. Researchers identified a massive red supergiant just before it exploded in a fiery supernova, an observation that helps explain why such stars are rarely seen exploding. The finding suggests these stellar giants are often obscured by thick clouds of dust.

Piercing Through the Dust

For decades, astronomers have puzzled over why massive red supergiants, which theoretical models predict should account for most supernovae, are seldom observed. This new JWST observation supports the theory that these stars are shrouded in dust, making them appear over 100 times dimmer and blocking shorter, bluer wavelengths of light. JWST's powerful infrared detection capabilities allowed it to pierce through this dusty veil and capture the longer red wavelengths, offering an unprecedentedly detailed look.

Red supergiants are among the largest stars in the universe.

The supernova, named SN 2025pht, was first detected in June from the galaxy NGC 1637, located 38 million light-years from Earth. By comparing historical Hubble data with new JWST images taken before and after the explosion, the team pinpointed the progenitor star.

"SN2025pht is surprising because it appeared much redder than almost any other red supergiant we've seen explode as a supernova." — Charlie Kilpatrick, Northwestern University

A Landmark Observation

This study marks the first time JWST has been used to identify a supernova progenitor, opening a new avenue for discovery. The data indicates the star shone about 100,000 times brighter than our sun, but the thick surrounding dust made it appear incredibly red and dim. This discovery helps close the gap between theoretical models and actual observations, confirming that red supergiants do explode as predicted—they were just hidden from view.

Key Takeaways

  • ✔ The JWST has identified a massive red supergiant star just before it went supernova, a first for the telescope.
  • ✔ The observation helps solve the mystery of why these stars are rarely seen exploding; they are often hidden by thick clouds of dust.
  • ✔ The star, located 38 million light-years away, was 100,000 times brighter than our sun but was heavily obscured by a dusty veil.
  • ✔ JWST's infrared capabilities were crucial for seeing through the dust that blocked other telescopes like Hubble.

articles.title: Solo Leveling: Ragnarok Gets U.S. Print Release After 2 Years
articles.excerpt: The highly anticipated sequel to the hit fantasy series, Solo Leveling: Ragnarok, will receive its first-ever official English print release in the U.S. in June 2026.
articles.author: CBR
articles.fullContent:
The world of Solo Leveling expands with the story of Sung Jinwoo's son.

'Ragnarok' Sequel Announced for English Print Release

The sequel to the popular series *Solo Leveling*, titled *Solo Leveling: Ragnarok*, has received its first-ever English print release, which was announced at New York Comic-Con 2025. Yen Press's K-comics imprint, Ize Press, will publish the manga adaptation, with Volume 1 scheduled for release in the U.S. in June 2026. Previously, the series was only available digitally in English on Tapas.

Following in the Father's Footsteps

*Solo Leveling: Ragnarok* follows the journey of Sung Suho, the son of the original protagonist Sung Jinwoo and Cha Haein. The story explores Suho's discovery of his lineage and the significant legacy he inherits from his powerful S-Rank Hunter father. The manga is adapted from the web novel by Daul, with artwork by JIN and Brix of REDICE Studio.

"Follow Jinwoo Sungâ€™s son as he discovers the truth behind his lineage and the weight of the legacy he never asked for." — Ize Press Official Description

The announcement comes as the original *Solo Leveling* manga continues to achieve massive success, recently surpassing *Absolute Batman* for the #1 spot on the New York Times' bestsellers list.

A New Chapter for a Global Hit

While Ize Press markets *Ragnarok* as a direct continuation, the original author, Chugong, has suggested it could be viewed as one of many possible scenarios, similar to parallel universes in other popular fiction. Regardless of its canonical status, the print release is highly anticipated by fans who have followed the digital version and are eager to add a physical copy to their collections.

Key Takeaways

  • ✔ *Solo Leveling: Ragnarok* will be released in print in English for the first time in the U.S. in June 2026.
  • ✔ The announcement was made at New York Comic-Con 2025 by Yen Press's imprint, Ize Press.
  • ✔ The sequel follows Sung Suho, the son of the original series' protagonist, Sung Jinwoo.
  • ✔ Previously, the series was only available to English readers digitally on the Tapas platform.

articles.title: Scientists Achieve Teleportation with Quantum Supercomputers
articles.excerpt: In a major breakthrough for distributed quantum computing, scientists have successfully 'teleported' data between two quantum computers, allowing them to work together as a single, more powerful machine.
articles.author: BGR
articles.fullContent:
Quantum entanglement allows for the instantaneous sharing of information between processors.

Quantum Breakthrough Enables Distributed Supercomputing

Scientists have achieved a form of quantum teleportation, though not in the way science fiction depicts. Rather than moving matter, a team from the University of Oxford successfully sent a quantum algorithm wirelessly from one quantum processor to another, enabling the two machines to function as a single, more powerful supercomputer. This was accomplished through quantum entanglement, where connected particles share information instantaneously over a distance.

The Power of Entanglement

The experiment involved linking two quantum computers separated by a distance of two metres. Through quantum entanglement, the processors could see each other's data and pool their resources without any matter being physically moved. This breakthrough addresses a key scalability problem in quantum computing, which has been limited by the difficulty of packing millions of qubits (the basic unit of quantum information) into a single device.

"This breakthrough will enable distributed quantum computing where many remote quantum processors can be combined into a unified quantum computer." — BGR

This new approach allows for a network of smaller quantum devices to be linked together, distributing computations and theoretically allowing for an unlimited number of processors in the network. The team successfully demonstrated the method by running Grover's search algorithm across the two linked machines.

A Step Towards the Quantum Internet

This achievement is a significant step towards creating a 'quantum internet,' a network of interconnected quantum computers that could tackle computational challenges far beyond the reach of today's most powerful conventional supercomputers. By sharing data instantaneously, these networked machines can solve problems they would be unable to handle individually, opening up new possibilities for science and technology.

Key Takeaways

  • ✔ Scientists used quantum entanglement to link two quantum computers, allowing them to share data and work as one.
  • ✔ This form of 'teleportation' transfers information, not physical matter.
  • ✔ The breakthrough helps solve the scalability problem of quantum computing by allowing smaller machines to be networked together.
  • ✔ This development is a foundational step toward building a powerful, distributed quantum internet.

articles.title: New Anime 'Daemons of the Shadow Realm' Set for April 2026
articles.excerpt: The upcoming anime adaptation of 'Daemons of the Shadow Realm', from the creator of Fullmetal Alchemist, is poised to become a major hit when it releases in April 2026.
articles.author: Game Rant
articles.fullContent:
The new series is from the acclaimed creator of Fullmetal Alchemist, Hiromu Arakawa.

Highly Anticipated Anime Set to Dethrone 'Solo Leveling'

A new anime adaptation, *Daemons of the Shadow Realm*, is scheduled for release in April 2026 and is already generating significant buzz. The series is based on the manga by Hiromu Arakawa, the celebrated author of *Fullmetal Alchemist*, and many believe it has the potential to become more popular than the current action anime juggernaut, *Solo Leveling*.

A Story of Siblings and Supernatural Beings

The story of *Daemons of the Shadow Realm* is set in a fantasy world and follows two siblings who get separated. The narrative also features supernatural creatures known as Daemons. The manga began serialisation in 2021 and has been praised for its story and characters, which many consider to be stronger than those in *Solo Leveling*. The anime is being produced by Bones Film, a subsidiary of the renowned Studio Bones, which is known for high-quality adaptations.

"The story and the characters in Daemons of the Shadow Realm are better than Solo Leveling. A proper adaptation can certainly increase the odds of the series dethroning Solo Leveling." — Game Rant

The strategic April 2026 release date avoids the crowded January 2026 window, which already includes new seasons for major titles like *Jujutsu Kaisen*, *Frieren: Beyond Journey's End*, and *Oshi no Ko*, giving the new series a better opportunity to stand out.

From a Legendary Creator

Given Hiromu Arakawa's reputation and the success of *Fullmetal Alchemist: Brotherhood*—one of the highest-rated anime series of all time—expectations for *Daemons of the Shadow Realm* are exceptionally high. With two trailers already released, fans have been given a glimpse of what promises to be a high-quality and faithful adaptation of the popular manga.

Key Takeaways

  • ✔ The anime adaptation of *Daemons of the Shadow Realm* is set for release in April 2026.
  • ✔ The series comes from Hiromu Arakawa, the acclaimed creator of *Fullmetal Alchemist*.
  • ✔ The story follows separated siblings in a fantasy world inhabited by supernatural 'Daemons'.
  • ✔ Many analysts believe its strong plot and character development give it the potential to become more popular than *Solo Leveling*.

articles.title: Humanoid Robotics AI Shows Advanced Developments in 2025
articles.excerpt: Recent breakthroughs in humanoid robotics AI are showcasing significant progress in real-world applications, with enhanced human-robot interaction and autonomous navigation driving new market opportunities.
articles.author: Blockchain.News
articles.fullContent:
Advancements in AI are making humanoid robots more capable of human-like interactions.

AI Breakthroughs Propel Humanoid Robot Development

Recent advancements in humanoid robotics AI are demonstrating significant progress in real-world applications, enhancing human-robot interaction, autonomous navigation, and adaptive learning capabilities. These developments are creating new business opportunities in key sectors like healthcare, manufacturing, and customer service. This trend highlights a growing market demand for intelligent humanoid solutions capable of transforming labour-intensive industries.

From Labs to Limited Production

The evolution of humanoid robots represents a pivotal advancement in artificial intelligence, blending sophisticated AI models with cutting-edge robotics. Companies like Tesla are accelerating the development of their Optimus humanoid robot, with Elon Musk announcing plans for limited production for internal use to begin in 2025, aiming for wider availability by 2026. This progress is built on foundational AI research in computer vision and spatial intelligence, which is crucial for robots to navigate real-world environments effectively.

Fine motor control is a key area of development for humanoid robots.

This rapid development is not limited to one company. The broader humanoid robot market is projected to grow substantially, from $1.5 billion in 2023 to over $38 billion by 2035. This growth is fuelled by applications in logistics, healthcare, and manufacturing, where robots can perform hazardous or repetitive tasks.

The Growing Market for Intelligent Machines

$38B+Projected humanoid robot market size by 2035
2025Year Tesla plans to begin limited Optimus production

The increasing sophistication of AI is the primary driver behind this trend. As AI models become better at understanding 3D environments and human interaction, the potential applications for humanoid robots expand. Businesses are exploring monetisation through leasing models and service subscriptions, which could significantly cut costs in labour-intensive sectors.

Key Takeaways

  • ✔ AI is enhancing humanoid robots with better navigation, interaction, and learning abilities.
  • ✔ Tesla plans to start limited production of its Optimus robot in 2025 for internal use.
  • ✔ The humanoid robot market is forecast to grow from $1.5 billion in 2023 to over $38 billion by 2035.
  • ✔ Growth is driven by applications in manufacturing, healthcare, and logistics, where robots can perform dangerous or repetitive work.

articles.title: Tesla Price Target Raised to $500 at RBC on Optimus Robot
articles.excerpt: RBC Capital Markets has significantly increased its price target for Tesla, citing the massive market opportunity presented by the company's Optimus humanoid robot.
articles.author: Investing.com
articles.fullContent:
RBC sees the humanoid robot market as a major new valuation driver for Tesla.

RBC Lifts Tesla Target on 'Massive' Optimus Opportunity

RBC Capital Markets raised its price target for Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) to $500 from $325, incorporating the potential of the company's Optimus humanoid robot into its valuation for the first time. The bank's analysts estimate that Tesla could capture a significant share of a projected ~$9 trillion humanoid robot market by 2050, viewing the opportunity as a key driver for the company's future growth.

A $9 Trillion Market

Following a tour of Tesla's Berlin Gigafactory, RBC noted that the company plans to integrate Optimus across three main verticals: manufacturing, hospitality, and consumer use. RBC believes the total addressable market (TAM) for humanoid robots could reach approximately $9 trillion globally by 2050, with the largest segments being households, agriculture, manufacturing, and retail.

"We estimate TSLA could capture 5% of our projected ~$9T humanoid robot market by 2050." — RBC Capital Markets

For Tesla specifically, RBC assumes a focus on the consumer, manufacturing, and hospitality segments, resulting in a Tesla-specific TAM of $4.3 trillion. Based on these assumptions, the analysts project that Tesla could generate $404 billion in humanoid-related revenue by 2050.

Revising Valuations

$500New Price Target from RBC
$9 TrillionProjected Humanoid Robot Market by 2050
$404 BillionPotential Annual Robot Revenue for Tesla

This new analysis fundamentally changes Tesla's valuation breakdown. According to RBC, the humanoid robot segment now accounts for 36% of its total valuation. This is followed by Robotaxi at 37%, Full Self-Driving (FSD) at 11%, and the traditional car and Megapack businesses each at 8%. This shift underscores the growing investor focus on Tesla's AI and robotics ambitions beyond its core automotive business.

Key Takeaways

  • ✔ RBC Capital Markets increased its Tesla price target from $325 to $500.
  • ✔ The new valuation is heavily based on the market potential of the Optimus humanoid robot.
  • ✔ RBC projects a global humanoid robot market of ~$9 trillion by 2050.
  • ✔ The Optimus robot division now represents 36% of RBC's total valuation for Tesla.

articles.fullContent:

videos.title: Quantum Computing Explained: The Next Tech Revolution!
videos.excerpt: An easy-to-follow visual guide on how quantum computers use the laws of physics to solve complex problems, covering concepts like qubits, superposition, and entanglement.
